channel.title: upstream on My Hugo
channel.description: Recent content in upstream on My Hugo

item.title: Setup Git Upstream
item.description: Create An Upstream Repo There are two types of repositories: bare: repositories do not have a working copy and you can push to them, for example, repositories that you get in github. Bare repositories work as upstreams. non-bare: repositories that you are working on, with a working copy. Repositories that you clone or init are non-bare by default. You can’t (by default) and shouldn’t push to non-bare repos. Note: technically, you can push to a non-bare repo (see below), but that is not a common practice.
